text:
I must be doing something very wrong. After updating to GLMakie 0.2.1 from 0.1.30 I can't create an axis.
```julia> fig = Figure()

julia> ax1 = fig[1, 1] = Axis(fig)
ERROR: ArgumentError: reducing over an empty collection is not allowed```
What am I missing?

elements.text: I must be doing something very wrong. After updating to GLMakie 0.2.1 from 0.1.30 I can't create an axis.

julia> fig = Figure()

julia> ax1 = fig[1, 1] = Axis(fig)
ERROR: ArgumentError: reducing over an empty collection is not allowed

text: uh interesting regression, I wonder why it wasn't caught. Maybe we never test an empty axis explicitly, and that triggers something

elements.text: uh interesting regression, I wonder why it wasn't caught. Maybe we never test an empty axis explicitly, and that triggers something

text: I'm using Julia 1.6-rc3 if it makes a difference.

elements.text: I'm using Julia 1.6-rc3 if it makes a difference.

text: Yeah I could reproduce it, it's one of those bugs for empty edge cases..

elements.text: Yeah I could reproduce it, it's one of those bugs for empty edge cases..

text: should I open an issue on Github?

elements.text: should I open an issue on Github?

text: not necessary, we're looking at it now

elements.text: not necessary, we're looking at it now

text: normal plots like `scatter(1:10)` do work, it's just the empty axis without previous intervention that does this

elements.text: do work, it's just the empty axis without previous intervention that does this

text:
Also the following for me breaks in 0.2.1
```leg =
    fig[2, 1:2] = Legend(
        fig,
        [scatt1, scatt2, scatt_s1],
        ["a", "b", "c"],
    )```
where scatt1, scatt2, scatt_s1 are created using `scatter!(ax1, observable)` . The plot renders correctly with the legend with the correct colours but the text is invisible. Although to be honest I don't know how my program reaches that point as the axis in this case is created as an empty axis. Yet in this case the program didn't give an error.

elements.text: Also the following for me breaks in 0.2.1

leg =
    fig[2, 1:2] = Legend(
        fig,
        [scatt1, scatt2, scatt_s1],
        ["a", "b", "c"],
    )
where scatt1, scatt2, scatt_s1 are created using

. The plot renders correctly with the legend with the correct colours but the text is invisible. Although to be honest I don't know how my program reaches that point as the axis in this case is created as an empty axis. Yet in this case the program didn't give an error.

text: ok maybe make an issue for that one so we can keep track :)

elements.text: ok maybe make an issue for that one so we can keep track :)

text: ok the axis bug is fixed, the legend bug not yet (although you can set bgcolor = :transparent because the bug is that the text is behind the background poly..)

elements.text: ok the axis bug is fixed, the legend bug not yet (although you can set bgcolor = :transparent because the bug is that the text is behind the background poly..)
